lines.text:
[putting on his hat to wave at the photographers that he has eluded by boarding the train secretly]
Do I look snappy?
You were both too surprised to *be* surprised.
I have this naive view that you should pursue principles without calculating the consequences.
You're no politician.
You don't have to remember a thing. You just read it!
I don't like *reading* a speech.
Did you think the Gettysburg Address was ad-libbed?
I have no intention of retiring to Hyde Park and rusticating.

I feel I've had to go through the fire for some reason. Eleanor, it's a hard way to learn humility, but I've had to learn it by crawling. I know what is meant "You must learn to crawl, before you can walk."

I often think of something Woodrow Wilson said to me. It is only once in a generation the people can be lifted above material things. That is why conservative government is in the saddle for two thirds of the time.
Caution, my friend, is the refuge of cowards.
Most of our blessings come in heavy disguises.

[upon hearing Eleanor was out giving a speech]
You know my feelings about politics generally. It's a tawdry business for a man. And I believe shocking for a woman.
I have no personal complaints. I'm lucky. I had rich parents.
Franklin, may I say a word?
Certainly, if you're going to agree with me.
Then I have nothing to say.
That is hardly a sign of wifely devotion.
When you're forced to sit a lot, and watch others move about, you feel apart, lonely - because you can't get up and pace around.
Louis, why in hell must you keep pacing up and down?
I'm nervous!
There is nothing so unattractive to a party as a defeated candidate.
Good morning to you, Mr. Howe. You're looking your usual dyspeptic self.
None of your amiable chatter, please.
I tried on a nurse's uniform. And while the skirt was rather flattering, I don't look well in white.

You must be aware of the fears that many Americans have when they contemplate the election of a Catholic to the presidency of the United States. The domination of the church over its members is well known, and Governor Smith is a devout Catholic.
Would it be more acceptable if he were a renegade Catholic?
God has an infinite variety of tasks. I don't believe he's available as campaign manager.
Frank, you handle that chair like a scooter.
